basics.name: Al Jachimiak
basics.label: Senior Developer
basics.summary:
After 15 years teaching in public schools, I made a huge leap into the software industry. Every day of my teaching career was an exercise in User Experience. What could I do to ease a student through the constant bombardment of new material? How could I make a student comfortable enough with unfamilliar information so they are willing to engage in the learning process?

I've taken this experience and integrated with my passion for technology. Now, I develop front-end user interfaces that are easy to use and create back-end API's that are developer-friendly, maitainable, and scalable.

work.summary: Castle Learning is a K-12 educational technology product that allows teachers to give students digital assignments and gives students a fully responsive platform to complete thier assignments.  We also provide analysis of student response data to help drive instruction, provide high quality content to teachers, and provide students with many different methods to review material and improve their skills.
highlights: Re-architeched the student interface to allow for full functionality on dektops, tablets, and phones
Implemented new reports for with client side charts and graphs for data interpretation
Helped design new data structures and modeling to increase query speed, lower network bandwidth of query results, and increase server-side data analysis algorithms

work.summary: Catalyst is an agency that provides full stack technology consulting.  Catalyst can produce small static websites, large and scalable content management systems, and deploy on-site and virtual network infrastructure for small businesses.
highlights: Big Blue Big Band: Designed and deployed a sleek and responsive promotional site for a New York swing band
UCMEA: Created anew responsive Wordpress site for a music educators association
Ameriprise Financial: When moving to a new office, managed network migration, testing, and hardware integration.
Conducted seven different bands, percussion ensembles, and jazz ensembles spanning grades 7-12.
Designed an Advanced Placement music theory curriculum.
Deployed computer based testing (Tao Testing)

volunteer.summary: The Hour of Code is a global movement reaching tens of millions of students in 180+ countries.

volunteer.organization: Mid Hudson Valley Linux Users Group
volunteer.summary: MHVLUG, founded in 2003, is an informal organization, that is first and foremost about making a constructive, sharing, and welcoming community. MHVLUG promotes the use and education of open technologies.
highlights: Used Vagrant to make the monthly presentation dev environent available across many platforms

references.name: Kris Walker, CTO - Oddnetworks.com
references.reference: Al is a multi faceted developer comfortable in a range of technologies used in modern web development...

references.name: Carlos Puchol, CEO - Amahi.org
references.reference: I am proud to recommend Al with highest regards! There are a few things that are rare to find in combination in a technical person. Al has both excellent design skills and great front-end web-development skills. If that is not rare enough unto itself, Al adds one more that truly sets him apart: he's easy to work with. He gets the requirements quickly and gets on his way...

references.name: Thomas Hein, Technical Services Coordinator - Wallkill CSD
references.reference: ...I assigned Al multiple projects, wireless deployment, IPad Cart deployment and Thin client rollout. Al completed each project, demonstrating his network and server administration skills. Al was a great asset...
